com.yantra.api.ycp.security

Interface modifyUserHierarchy

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCPApi, YIFApi

    public interface modifyUserHierarchy

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document modifyUserHierarchy(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The modifyUserHierarchy API updates a User hierarchy based on the passed XML.

    • Method Detail

      • modifyUserHierarchy

        org.w3c.dom.Document modifyUserHierarchy(YFSEnvironment env,
                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                         java.rmi.RemoteException

        The modifyUserHierarchy API updates a User hierarchy based on the passed XML. The XML format includes the SubUser tag to indicate child Users. It validates that the user exists and that the datasecurity id for the user is valid for the organization code specified. An additional Reset attribute can be used to indicate if the child Users list needs to be rebuilt. User can also add or delete printer preference based on the XML input passed under UserPrinterPreferences tag.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPCheckPasswordsMatchUE when a password is given.
        com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPValidateChangedPasswordUE when the password is changed.

        Events Raised:

        Events raised during transaction CHANGE_AUTH_ANSWER.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised when at least one auth answer for the user was created/modified and not deleted.
            Data published : CHANGE_AUTH_ANSWER.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Template Support : Yes

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        Empty XML Document Object (for future use only).

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
